headline: Banks kick off earnings, Fed Chair Powell speaks: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime host Josh Lipton takes a look at the top stories for investors to watch on Tuesday, Oct. 14. Earnings season kicks off, with JPMorgan Chase (JPM), Wells Fargo (WFC), Goldman Sachs (GS), Citi (C), BlackRock (BLK), and Johnson & Johnson (JNJ) all reporting results. Federal Reserve commentary is expected from Fed Chair Jerome Powell, Fed Vice Chair for Supervision Michelle Bowman, Fed Governor Christopher Waller, and Boston Fed President Susan Collins. The Small Business Association's (SBA's) National Federation of Independent Business (NFIB) September Small Business Optimism Index will be published in the morning. Economists are expecting a slight decrease from the prior month. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

Federal Reserve commentary is expected from Fed Chair Jerome Powell, Fed Vice Chair for Supervision Michelle Bowman, Fed Governor Christopher Waller, and Boston Fed President Susan Collins.

The Small Business Association's (SBA's) National Federation of Independent Business (NFIB) September Small Business Optimism Index will be published in the morning. Economists are expecting a slight decrease from the prior month.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Citigroup Declares Common Stock Dividend
summary: NEW YORK, October 13, 2025--The Board of Directors of Citigroup Inc. today declared a quarterly dividend on Citigroup’s common stock of $0.60 per share, payable on November 26, 2025, to stockholders of record on November 3, 2025.

content.title: Citigroup Declares Common Stock Dividend
content.summary: NEW YORK, October 13, 2025--The Board of Directors of Citigroup Inc. today declared a quarterly dividend on Citigroup’s common stock of $0.60 per share, payable on November 26, 2025, to stockholders of record on November 3, 2025.

headline: US stocks rebound on US-China trade latest, Big Bank earnings on deck
summary: Julie Hyman outlines three things investors are watching on Monday, Oct. 13. US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) rebound after Trump signaled a willingness to negotiate with China. The president's comments on US-China trade talks are a shift from his comments on Friday, which sent equities tumbling by roughly $2 trillion. Investors are watching for Big Bank earnings with Goldman Sachs (GS), JPMorgan Chase (JPM), Wells Fargo (WFC), and Citi (C) reporting on Tuesday. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

Julie Hyman outlines three things investors are watching on Monday, Oct. 13.

US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) rebound after Trump signaled a willingness to negotiate with China. The president's comments on US-China trade talks are a shift from his comments on Friday, which sent equities tumbling by roughly $2 trillion. Investors are watching for Big Bank earnings with Goldman Sachs (GS), JPMorgan Chase (JPM), Wells Fargo (WFC), and Citi (C) reporting on Tuesday.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Markets are hoping China-US trade tensions will ease
summary: US stocks surged before the bell on Monday, bouncing back from Friday's rout after President Trump played down the escalating US trade standoff with China, saying it "will all be fine!" Russ Mould, Investment Director at AJ Bell believes that markets are hoping that President Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping will still meet at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit in South Korea later this month. For more live coverage of markets watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

headline: Bank earnings: Why Goldman and Citi could outperform the pack
summary: Earnings season is about to kick off for Big Banks this week, with JPMorgan (JPM), Wells Fargo (WFC), Goldman Sachs (GS), and Citigroup (C) reporting quarterly results on Tuesday, October 14, followed by Bank of America (BAC) and Morgan Stanley (MS) on Wednesday. CFRA Research Director of Equity Research Ken Leon sits down with Market Domination host Josh Lipton to discuss the two banking leaders that his firm likes ahead of their earnings. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

CFRA Research Director of Equity Research Ken Leon sits down with Market Domination host Josh Lipton to discuss the two banking leaders that his firm likes ahead of their earnings.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Mainland Chinese financial firms seeking strategic Hong Kong headquarters on the rise: Citigroup
summary: A growing number of mainland Chinese financial institutions and international companies have shown interest in establishing regional headquarters in Hong Kong to tap into increasing business opportunities across the region, according to the head of Citigroup's local unit.
